inn1.comm: full length on off stump as he  comes forward, keeps bat and pad together and pushes it into the covers. Amla calls for the single and de Kock and South Africa are off the mark
good line and a hint of swing inward as Amla stays balanced and blocks it back to the bowler
oh, too full that time and on the pads. That's too easy for Amla. Clips it effortlessly through the gap between mid-on and midwicket and the ball just races away
exploits the angle across the right hander and gets his usual steep bounce as Amla shoulders arms and the keeper collects it chest high
back of a length ball on off stump as Amla gets back and across to play it beneath his eyes.
another solid block off the back foot to end the first over. A little fuller from Irfan but he was homing in around off stump
full and just a tad outside off, de Kock nudges forward and pushes back down the pitch.

muted appeal but there was an inside edge. good lines from the two left arm quicks here. Full and shaping in and de Kock moved forward to defend, but had a little gap between bat and pad. The ball deflects onto his pad. Didn't look too convincing there
full and pushed into his pads, de Kock stays in his crease and works it away in front of square on the leg side
invites the drive and Amla obliges, going forward and presenting the full face of the bat. But it was a checked stroke so it goes only to mid-off
gets back behind the line of that full length ball on off stump and keeps it out
concentrates on a fullish line again and de Kock is drawn forward into a defensive stroke which goes to cover
full and straight from Irfan and Amla can't do much more than protect his stumps with a good straight bat
targets the off stump this time and Amla moves back and across, has his head right over the ball and blocks it to point
another back of a length ball on and around off stump and this one is quite pacy - 142 kph - but Amla's block is up to it

gorgeous! Just a push and it beats the fielder and goes off into the extra cover boundary. No exaggerated foot work, but what was there was enough to get him close enough to the ball that was pitched on a good length and angled across the batsman. Amla met the ball solidly and just timed it, and boy did he ever succeed.
back of a length, pushed across the batsman and Amla wants nothing to do with it
yorker! It was right on middle stump but Amla jabs his bat down just in time

dropped! Hafeez is the culprit at first slip. De Kock was lazy outside off stump, flashing at the good length ball and a genuine edge was taken. It flew to the right of Hafeez who was diving with the ball and grabbed at it with hard hands and spills it
shortish ball outside off and he goes for the cut, but there is no timing in the shot, possibly because his feet were rooted to the crease
an Amla special that. It was a half-volley outside off and he glides forward and caresses it through the covers, piercing the off side field perfectly
a tighter line on middle stump and Amla pushes it down the ground off the back foot

good length ball on middle and he pushes it to mid-on. Amla wants the singe, but it was ill judged. Misbah attempts to throw down the stumps at the non-strikers' and had he succeeded it might have been very close
he wasn't too comfortable playing that one either. It was back of a length and rising outside off, and he goes back and gets a leading edge through point. A little luck fetches him two runs
oh, just a whip of the wrists and off it goes. It was a poor ball, well down the leg side and he exhibits impeccable timing again as the ball goes in the air and off to the vacant fine leg boundary
he is on song! Another crisp drive through point this time and Amla hasn't even bothered to run. It was a half-volley outside off, asking to be put away and it got what it deserved
shortish and on middle as Amla works it through midwicket off the back foot
opens the face and steers the back of a length delivery away to third man off the back foot
gets a thickish inside edge as he looks to drive the good length ball outside off stump through the covers and it goes down to mid-on
lovely line just outside off stump as de Kock is forced to play away from his body again. He goes on the back foot and pushes it to mid-off
steers the good length ball outside off to point off his back foot
very tight on middle, with a hint of inward shape, de Kock blocks it off the front foot
another quick single. This was full on the off stump and he drives it straight to mid-off and sets off. The fielder has a shy at the stumps, but by that time de Kock was in
gets right behind that  ball homing in on top of off and with his head over the ball, blocks it.
another good length delivery on the wicket-to-wicket line as Amla shuffles back to defend
he attacks him straight away. That ball was not quite as short as de Kock must have seen it to be. He swivels on the back foot and goes for an almighty pull but cannot time it
goes forward and opens the face of his bat just a tad on impact as he sends the full length ball on the off stump corridor to cover
slapped straight to short cover. He skipped down the track a little and slammed the good length ball straight to Soahib Maqsood, who does very well, grabbing it head high to his right
much better. This ball was on middle and leg and de Kock presents a tight back foot defence, with bat and pad close together
a little whip of the wrists allows him to place this good length ball on middle just wide of midwicket and gets off strike.
and finishes with a dot ball, courtesy a fullish length on off stump. Amla gets back and blocks to cover
back of the hand slower ball but his accuracy is very good. De Kock stays on the back foot and defends the good length ball on off stump
gets forward and drives the length ball on the up to mid-off

short ball and it was wonderfully directed. De Kock was forced off his feet as he looked to hook the ball. The ball came onto him a little quicker and lobbed up off the splice to go on the bounce to mid-on

good looking drive, it was on the up again, but this time he beats the man at short cover. Mid-off collects it and tries to hit the stumps, but with both batsmen already safe, that was ill advised and it hurts Pakistan bu going off for overthrows. Misbah is not at all pleased
back of a length on the off stump and he goes back to defend

and that was what he was looking for all through this over. Good length ball, outside off and he slaps it through cover and because he wasn't looking to hit the ball too hard, he met it well and the ball skidded off to the boundary
steers the shortish ball calmly to third man to get off strike
another swipe from de Kock as he pulls the length ball through midwicket and picks up a single
goes right across his stumps and manoeuvers the full length ball on off stump through square leg
slashed off the front foot. There was ample room there and de Kock pounced on it. That's his strength and the ball screams away just to the left of point

beats him with a beauty. That deserved a wicket. It was a just short of a good length and the ball straightens after pitching. De Kock's outside edge is comfortably beaten and it goes just a couple of inches over the top of off stump too. Very lucky to survive is de Kock
on a good length on off stump and he goes back to defend safely
tossed up on off stump and Amla gets forward and drives confidently to the man at cover
shorter and quicker, 92kph, and Amla moves back and whip it to midwicket
flatter ball again but this time the batsman goes back and works it down the ground to long-on to collect a single
full and on leg stump as he steps forward and works it to midwicket
another full length ball on leg stump, not too much turn for him here, as de Kock gets forward and blocks
just straightens a tad after pitching, but the ball was angled on his pads. De Kock presses forward and nudges it to square leg
good straight bat to meet the full length ball on off stump. Mid-off runs around to get a hand to it but not before the batsmen took a single
tucks him up as he directs this good length ball on middle and leg. De Kock goes back and works it off his hips behind square on the leg side
looks to force the fullish ball on off stump off the back foot, but he can't pierce the cover field

another example of the strength of Amla's wrists. That was well outside off stump but he had jumped across to the off side and clipped it away to mid-on where Irfan goes down into an awkward dive to field it
slower short ball, but de Kock is not fooled. He goes back and carefully pulls it down as the ball goes off to deep fine leg

and thats South Africa's fifty. This certainly wasn't slow but Amla produces a strong pull shot, keeps it down as well and runs through for a single as the ball trickles away to deep square leg. First fifty-run stand for these two
holds it back just a tad and Amla was looking to charge him but chooses against it as he pushes down to midwicket
this time he does nip down the track and having reached the pitch of the ball, which was tossed up a little more, drives it down to long-on
full length ball pitching on off stump and turning just a tad as de Kock comes forward and defends
inside edged to midwicket when he was looking to drive that full length ball on off stump through the covers. de Kock needs to be more patient here
better, reaches the pitch and works the flighted ball on leg stump down to mid-on

oh, another sumptuous drive from Amla. He's looking good for a big on today. Tossed up, but Ajmal committed the mistake of affording too much room. The batsman took a good stride forward and flayed the ball through cover to collect another powerful boundary
worked away through midwicket as Junaid bowls a full length ball, which was angled into his pads
allows the length ball on off stump to come it him and plays it to third man using soft hands.

oh, chinese cut! but all is well in the end. it was the slower ball but Junaid lost his accuracy there. There was ample room to slam that through point and cover, but the lack of pace did him in. Umar Akmal the keeper dives to his right and makes a useful save
oh, he's dismissed that. It was not a bad ball at all, pitching on middle at a good length. But de Kock had already decided this one had to go and just lifted it over mid-on and midwicket
still targets the pads of the batsman as de Kock works it off squre on the leg side and collects a single
on a good length just outside off stump and Amla drives it off the back foot down the ground
and he tosses it up to start, asking the batsman to come forward. De Kock does so and pushes it through the covers
full and on middle as Amla works it away to deep midwicket

hits it on the up and it was quite close to the fielder at mid-off. There was a little turn on offer for Afridi there as the ball was pitched on a good length at middle and off. In the end it was good placement as he collects two runs
more flight from Afridi and Amla gets forward and pushes down to long-on
flighted ball outside off and de Kock was looking to push it through cover, but only manges an inside edge as the ball goes off into he leg side
shortish outside off and Amla stays back and pushes it between point and cover to retain strike
full ball on off stump and he comes forward and drives down to long-on
tossed up again, this time on middle stump as he gets forward and blocks
a little turn for Hafeez as the full ball takes the outside edge as de Kock looked to defend
chipped down the track and works the full length ball away to square leg
steers the good length ball outside off stump to point
waits for it and works it just to the right of fine leg to pick up a single to end the over
calmly pushes the full length ball outside off stump down to long-on
flatter and possibly a little quicker as Amla shuffles back and across and whips it away through square leg

leading edge, but it amounts to nothing. De Kock was playing with the turn as he looked to work it through square leg, but he was too early into the shot and the ball looped up in the air for a very short distance but it was all safe.

appeal for stumping as de Kock is drawn forward and is beaten outside the off stump. Has he overbalanced? Yes he has but he regained it just in time. The back foot lifted in the air just a bit, but he dragged it back before the keeper whipped the bails off

oh, lovely. He was hitting against the turn, but he made sure he wasn't hitting the ball too hard, reached the pitch of the ball and just caressed it through extra cover. Ajmal makes a valiant attempt, but he comes up short
tossed up on middle this time and he drives it down to long-on
turn there, and de Kock was almost squared up. In the end he gets an outside edge
flighted ball outside off stump and he leans on his front foot to push into the covers
full and on leg stump as he comes forward and drives to long-on
full length ball outside off and Amla gets forward and drives down the ground
flat bats the shortish ball down pitched on middle stump down the ground
waits for the ball to spin, but there is very little on offer as he gets forward and defends solidly to usher drinks onto the field
full and outside off stump and de Kock plays it with soft hands towards point
he's reading the ball of the pitch, stays on his back foot and punches it through to sweeper cover
well played and well fielded! It was slower from Afridi and de Kock waited for it, and opened the face to steer it fine of short third man, but Irfan goes down and keeps it as a dot ball
flatter and quicker, 94kph as he goes back and punches down the pitch
this time there is a lot more flight and de Kock drives the ball well to sweeper cover
goes on the front foot and drives it through the covers to retain strike

he's cleaned up! Amla had no feet there as he was looking to sneak some runs through third man by opening the face of his bat. But he does not make contact having played inside the line, might just have overestimated the turn there, and has his off stump pegged back
tossed up on off stump and he nudges it down to long-on to get off the mark
holds this back and de Kock comes forward and blocks it back to the bowler a little forcefully
this one is just a little outside off and de Kock pushes it to cover. Wasn't too convincing with the stroke though
gets forward and blocks the full length ball on middle
chips down the track and works the flighted ball away to midwicket
tossed up outside off as he goes forward and blocks
another flighted ball, this time a little closer as he drives down to long-on

Afridi is immensely excited there. He signaled for a review over ten times. It was the slider and du Plessis was rapped on the pads while he was going forward to defend. The impact was in line, but hawk eye shows the ball would only have clipped leg stump so umpire's call stands
charges forward and having reached the pitch of the ball, defends
this time he opens the face of the bat and works the full length ball outside off to point
chips down the track again to meet the good length ball on off stump and he defends to cover
that was full of length, but de Kock still stayed back and cut the ball away through point
moves to the leg side and and works it down the ground to pick up a single
oh, well played. He came down the track and just chipped the fullish ball on middle over the in field and the ball had enough on it to run off to the midwicket boundary
stays back and guides it away to short third man
tosses it up on middle as Faf gets forward and keeps it out
forays down the track again as he nudges the full length ball on off stump through point and takes off for a single
another slider to Faf but this time he gets his bat on the ball
95 kph and this one turns a little away as Faf moves across to the off side and blocks off the back foot
goes forward and nudges it away straight of midwicket
flighted ball on off stump as he presses forth and defends
and that is it. Maiden half-century for de Kock as he works this good length ball through point with an open face
charges down the track to meet the slider, but he gets struck on his front pad.
full length ball is worked away to square leg
goes down for the sweep but it was a little too full for that as the ball sneaks under his bat and to the keeper
adjusts at the last minute as he opens the face of the bat whilst being stuck on the crease and defends
angled into the pads as he clips it through square leg for a single
moves around in the crease and finally manages to work it away to the leg side and take a single
good length ball on middle stump as de Kock goes back and punches down the ground to long-on
flighted on off stump and he trudges forward, keeping bat and pad together as he defends
and all this pressure has made the batsman try something different. De Kock pulls out the reverse sweep and manages to get just enough bat on it to manouever the ball to third man
goes back and punches it through extra cover as Afridi drops it just a little short outside off
chips it in the air as he meets the full length ball outside off with a good straight bat and collects a couple to long-off
full length ball on middle as he drives down to long-on this time
tossed up from Afridi and Faf is happy to keep it out off the front foot
flatter ball on off stump which allows the batsman to stay back and punch it just a little wide of long-on
sees the ball flighted a little and chips down the track to whip it to midwicket
he was looking to charge the bowler again, but this time Hafeez pushes it through quickly and Faf just manages to dig it out down the ground
flatter ball on leg stump and he clips it away to midwicket
that one turns a tad, but he rides the turn as he opens the face of his bat and nudges it to point
flattish delivery on middle and he stays back to push down to long-on
tossed up outside off and de Kock gets a little more practice at opening the face of his bat and steering the ball through the covers
and Faf continues to use the crease with exaggerated effect. Goes a long way leg side and the bowler follows him, forcing him to defend down the pitch
and this time his innovation works. Excellent shot inside out over extra cover, made possibly by a little shuffle outside leg stump and a lovely straight follow through
tossed up on middle again and Faf stays firm and works it away to midwicket
flatter ball on middle stump allows de Kock to go back and punch it to the bowler
full length ball outside off and de Kock drives through the covers
shortish ball just outside off stump and de Kock relishes the extra pace on the ball, pulling it powerfully in front of square. And he kept it down as well. Excellent shot
off cutter from Irfan and de Kock could have been cleaned up had that nippled back just an inch more. There was a gigantic a big gap between bat and pad, with his feet rooted to the crease
worked away through midwicket, who should have done a little better to stop that. It was a fullish ball on middle
oh, bounce and seam away! Faf hangs his bat out and would be thanking his stars for not nicking that one. Delicious seam bowling from the big man

oh, he's thrown it away! Faf was always looking a little too active at the crease. He charges the quick and goes through with his stroke despite not reaching the pitch of the ball. His intended hoist over the top only gets the bottom of the bat and it skies up to cover where Saeed Ajmal takes a simple catch
good length ball outside off as de Kock nudges forward and drives square into the off side
good length ball on off stump and turns in just a little as AB goes back, waits for it and punches down the pitch
fuller length this time and he goes forward to block it back to Ajmal
goes back and tries to punch it down to long-on but cannot get good enough bat
this time he succeeds as the good length ball is driven of the back foot to long-on
tossed up a little slower and de Kock was a little too soon into his defence as he gets an inside edge which squirts off to square leg
appreciable turn that time, but AB is up to it as he goes back and whips it through to deep midwicket
goes right across outside his off stump but Irfan is wise to it as he follows AB with a full length ball and forces him to defend down the ground
another little shuffle outside off, but this time AB allows the length ball outside off to go through to the keeper
full and on off stump as AB presses forward and squirts it away through cover for a single
that was a little short and wide, but AB being the new man looked to steer the ball rather than flay it and the ball goes straight to point.
short of a length on off stump, but AB this time isn't afraid to be a little innovative as he uses his wrists to whip it away to midwicket
good length ball just outside off, but de Kock uses the little room available to guide the ball to deep third man to keep strike
flighted ball outside off stump as de Kock drives the ball through to sweeper cover
good length ball on middle and off as he goes back and punches it wide of long-on
good length just outside off but de Kock moves back and goes leg side to cut the ball in front of square on the off side to get off strike
uses the crease very well there as he goes back to make that ball a little shorter than it actually was and cuts it well to deep point
just a little bit of extra bounce there but de Kock was playing with soft hands so his defensive push fell safely at his feet
pushes it through on his pads and is worked away comfortably off the back foot to midwicket
another short ball and it is dealt with quite confidently. He was waiting on his back foot and pulls it dead square to the fielder in the deep
uses the left-armer's angle across him to dab the ball to deep third man off the back foot and takes the single. AB's been his usual busy self here
almost a yorker on off stump and de Kock drills it back to the bowler
good length ball, but with a little room outside off de Kock cuts it through to deep point

Irfan continues to make the same mistake. He was able to get de Kock into trouble when he was bowling full and even more so when he bowled short the batsman looked completely untroubled. This time was no different as he pulled through midwicket
better. fuller length which forces the batsman who was on the back foot to push down the ground
negotiates the full length ball on off stump with a little push into the covers and sets off for a quick single
fuller length but this was on the pads. de Kock nnudges it to square leg off the back foot
full and pushed through outside off stump but de Kock drills it down to long-on
short and just a little wide outside off as AB moves back and across to cut to point, where Ajmal makes a diving save
full and outside off as AB comes forward and presents the perfect straight bat to take a single to long-on
slices that off the outside edge as his front foot stride is not long enough to reach the full length ball and it runs away through the covers
offers width and is immediately punished. Waits for that shortish ball and places it well to the left of point and has hit it well enough to beat third man on the boundary. Lovely shot
stays leg side of the full length ball as he defends the ball into the off side
targets the top of off stump as he makes the batsman come forward and drive through the covers
goes right across his stumps and works the ball pitching on off stump through to square leg
a good looking drive, albeit ill timed, to the good length ball and takes it through to mid-off
a more forceful hit this time as Junaid goes fuller outside off stump, and mid-off is in business again
it was the one that goes straight on and de Kock read it off the pitch, slapping it back to the bowler
pushes it through on his pads and de Kock works it away through midwicket
goes a little overboard with the flight there as the ball ends up a full toss and AB drives it strongly down the ground
good length ball, just a tad outside off and de Kock makes a little room for himself and works it away between cover and point for a couple
tossed up delivery and de Kock makes use of the flight by square driving it through point
goes back and hits the length ball turning just a little away from him through extra cover
tucks him up for room and AB is up for it, using soft hands to dab the ball into the off side and he sets off for a well judged single
on a full length homing in on middle as he pushes it to mid-on. AB wanted a single, but he slipped which put paid to that idea. Just as well, I didn't think there was a single there
well bowled. Right up there in the block hole and it made de Kock look a little ungainly as he made sure his legs were out of the way of the ball and worked it away through square leg

misfielded at point. Ahmed Shehzad is the man and had he picked it up, there could have been trouble, at either end. Both batsmen hesitated midway though the pitch as AB dabbed the ball, wanting to guide it to third man but couldn't get it fine enough. The Pakistan fielding coach slaps his head in disgust
goes fullish and straight to de Kock and he gets forward and blocks it to midwicket
slower ball - 114 kph - pitched short of a length outside off and de Kock is happy to work it to cover and with that we go to drinks

oh, he goes for the heave ho straight away. But he cant connect as the ball hits his inside thigh and trickles away to the keeper who tries to stump the batsman, but AB plonks his foot back inside the crease
good length ball on middle is pushed down to long-on
tossed up on his pads and de Kock looked to work it away through midwicket, but only gets a leading edge
full length ball outside off and he drives it well to the cover field
flatter ball on middle as he comes forward and blocks
goes for the sweep as Ajmal pushes it through on his pads, but the ball was a little too full again he can't connect
full and angled across the batsman and AB plays a confident square drive with a high front elbow and the ball made a crisp sound as it was hit, but there is a sweeper cover
width outside off and it is slammed over wide mid-off. It wasn't quite on the up, but it wasn't a half-volley either. The room made that shot possible and de Kock made full use of it
tucks him up and that reached him a little quicker than he anticipated, but he did well, removing the top hand as he defended
swipes across the line, even as AB asked him to play proper cricket shots, as the full length ball on middle takes a thick inside edge through midwicket
full and in his efforts to prevent any more room, goes a little too much on the pads and AB drives it down to long-on
on the pads again, this time to the left-hander, but he is not able to take advantage. de Kock was looking to flick the ball away but only manages to get a leg bye

Oh Pakistan, what are you doing?! Square leg sends in a swift throw on the bounce but Ajmal fails to collect it and had he done so properly de Kock would have been out. First off it was an excellent ball - the doosra - and he was beaten all ends up. The keeper couldn't collect and it was down to Afridi who did well but the finish was completely off
oh terrific strike. That was a good length ball turning into him and he just lofted it straight of midwicket imperiously
full length ball and AB comes forward, with his head over the ball and flicks it to square leg
tossed up again and this time de Kock drives down to long-on

oh, this is tremendous batting from AB. He was moving around in the crease and this time he made some room for himself outside leg, and when Ajmal followed him, he just whipped the full length ball over midwicket for a smart boundary
quicker ball, 105 kph, and it is a full toss and AB went down to sweep but cannot make any contact
lovely shot, just looked to push the full length ball down the ground to collect a single
full length ball on off stump and AB drives down the pitch
oh my God, what a strike! AB goes outside off, gets down on one knee and just swipes the ball over the top of fine leg for an incredible boundary. That is an AB special.
and for the follow up he just dabs the full length ball through the covers for a single. Ironically I think it pitched the same area as the last ball
roughs him up with the short ball. Wonderfully directed as it rose toward de Kock's head and he ducks underneath it after initially wanting to play

Holy moly! There it is and what a way to bring it up! De Kock gets underneath the length ball and slams it over wide long on and it goes all the way. He has a giant smile on his face as AB already had his hands in the air to celebrate the achievement. Maiden century for the 20-year-old
AB moved to the leg side to cut the ball, Ajmal followed him with a quicker, flatter ball and in the end beat him
whips the full length ball on middle through midwicket
flatter ball on the pads and de Kock works it away to square leg
goes on the bounce to the man at long-on. It was a shortish ball from Ajmal and he moved back to slam it over cow corner, but didn;t time it too well
tucks him up on middle and leg and de Kock pushes it past Ajmal and the batsmen collect a single
moves to the leg side again and as Ajmal follows him, he turns it through midiwcket
full length ball on off stump and AB slams it straight to Irfan at mid-off

leading edge and Hafeez holds onto it this time. ABdV is gone! He moved across to the off side and was intending to slam the ball over midwicket, but the ball lobs up in the air towards the cover region where Hafeez runs back, extends his hands well and takes it safely. Good catch that and AB leaves the field, practicing a straight loft
turned away wide of the man at fine leg. That was the yorker gone wrong as Junaid bowls a full toss on the pads of the batsman who only had to place it and so he did
slower ball, 115 kph, on a good length and de Kock manages to work it to square leg off the back foot
another good length ball on middle and he works it away off the back foot to midwicket to get off the mark
slower ball again - 116kph - this time outside off as de Kock dabs it away to point
that was full on the off stump and Miller got forward to defend but gets a thick inside edge
more solid defense from the batsman as he reaches the pitch of the full length ball on leg stump
pushed through on the pads and Miller can't take advantage as he looks to beat fine leg, but he cannot get bat on it
tossed up on the pads and de Kock whips it away straight of midwicket and immediately calls for two
flighted ball again and this time de Kock is happy with a drive down the ground for a single
Miller goes for the drive through the off side to the full length ball, but he only manages an inside edge
refuses to allow the batsman to free his arms as the indipper forces him to go back in his crease and defend into the leg side
more swing inward, but this time Miller was on the front foot and is better equipped to negotiate the full length ball off to fine leg

he's found mid-off this time! That's the end of a gritty innings from de Kock. He was tiring and the ball was full and wide, inviting a slam over the top. He had made a little room for himself outside leg and did his best, but the ball went only as far as Misbah-ul-Haq, who dives forward and takes a good catch

giant appeal from the bowler, but umpire Ahsan Raza spotted the inside edge from Duminy. It was a good length ball, coming into him and he was stuck in the crease looking to defend. If not for the bit of bat, JP was a goner
gets behind the ball angled into him and opens the face on impact to try and sneak a single on the off side but to no avail
this time he gets off the mark by working the full length ball swinging into his pads with soft hands and races off down the pitch before the fielder at midwicket could collect the ball
full, flighted ball on and around off stump as Duminy drives down the ground
good length ball on middle was met off the back foot and worked away straight of the man at midwicket for a couple
goes for the sweep as Hafeez bowls a flatter, fuller ball on off stump, but he fails to connect with the ball.

Oh, he's gone now! It was the sweep shot again, only this time he was struck right in line of the stumps off a fuller ball pitching on middle and turning just a shade away. Miller chats with Duminy and opts for the review and it doesn't look good. An inside edge was the only thing that could have saved him and there was none. Hawkeye suggests the ball would have grazed off stump and that is enough because the umpire gave it out originally
gets forward and blocks the full length ball outside off
another confident stride forward to defend the full length ball outside off stump

Junaid is relentless, especially since JP has come out. No room to work the ball and the hint of in dip always keeps the lbw in play. This time though the batsman goes back and works the full length ball into the leg side
goes a little shorter and that allows Duminy to pull the ball through square leg and get off strike
Bouncer! and McLaren ducks beneath it. Well directed delivery, coming at the batsman's neck and at decent pace, but he gets his head under the ball just in time
oh, Irfan... he dove a little too quickly and cannot reach the ball at midwicket. McLaren worked that full length ball on his pads quite smartly, but that did not deserve the boundary it got
good length ball on middle stump and he works it away into the leg side
118 kph slower ball, he's used that well throughout his spell but McLaren is up to it, waiting for the ball and just guiding it away using the open face to third man
short of a good length, but there is not enough room for the batsman to free his arms and instead he just dabs it through point
fuller ball this time and he comes forward nicely to drive it through the off side
chips down the track to meet the pitch of the ball and drive it down to long-on
91kph, a little flatter and on middle, and McLaren goes back and push it back down the pitch
very little flight offered now, but the ball was still full as McLaren uses his wrists to whip it away through midwicket
stays back and leg side of the ball to cut it through extra cover and collect a couple
oh, that was well bowled. full length ball right on off stump and McLaren was in two minds, whether to whip it away or just defend it. In the end, he just pushes it down the pitch
doosra that time and he only plays it off the pitch, and because of that he is late on the cut shot and cannot get bat to it
full and flighted as McLaren gets forward nad pushes it away to midwicket
flatter and quicker and JP gets behind it and blocks
oh, the bowler runs all the way to midwicket to field that one. He targeted the stumps which allowed the left hander to work it off his pads
tossed up this time and McLaren uses his reach to push it into the covers
goes across to the off side and clips the ball to wide mid-on as Tanvir starts off with a good length ball on off stump

attempts a short ball, but with fine leg inside the circle that was a horrible idea. McLaren shuffles across to the off side and pulls it wide of the short fine leg fielder and collects a simple boundary
another short ball and this time he pulls it square on the leg side and takes a single
room outside off and he flays it off the front foot, but point is on hand to stop it from fetching any runs
oh what a shot! On the up and slapped through extra cover. There was a little room on offer and with mid-off up in the circle there was only one result after he had struck the ball so firmly
gets a bit of a leading edge as the full length ball goes down the ground. Tanvir cannot get to it and the batsman rush off for a single
flatter ball on middle and leg and he goes across to the off side to whip it off to square leg
he goes down on one knee, trying to do the same thing AB had done, but he cant hit it quite as fine as square leg gets hold of the ball
slog sweep and it goes all the way. There was a little extra flight in that and Duminy got to the pitch and just slammed if all the way. Powerful strike
held back just a bit, and Duminy adjusts as he defends the ball with soft hands, pushes it into the off side and gets a single

doosra doesn't matter. This one is sent sailing as well. McLaren goes for the slog sweep as well and this was hit even harder and clears the midwicket boundary comfortably, even if it was hit tremendously flat
goes for the reverse sweep, but misses and the keeper is in the way to prevent any runs. Thats an expensive end to Ajmal's spell. First time in 10 ODIs that he hasn't picked up a wicket
full and just a little wide of off stump as JP drills it down the ground
that was a slower ball, on a length, and he shuffles across to the off side and pulls it through square leg
wide yorker forces McLaren to reach out to meet it and then takes off for a single
well bowled, but it still goes for runs. It was the yorker outside off stump again and Duminy manages to guide it wide of third man
slower ball again and Duminy is deceived. He was looking to hoick it away over the leg side, but the lack of pace ensured the does not connect

and the fifty partnership is raised with a blistering extra cover drive. He was looking for the wide yorker again, but this time it was overpitched and McLaren slammed it away with all his might to finish the innings

inn2.comm: starts off with a typical Steyn outswinger. Lovely line just outside off and the fuller length elicits immediate response as the ball seams away. Shehzad watches it carefully and lets it go
more shape away from the batsman as he continues attacking a fuller length. Shehzad isn't tempted y this either
this time it swings into the batsman, but with the ball starting outside the off stump, there was no danger of his stumps being disturbed and so he lets it go
full and straight and Shehzad has to use his bat this time as he defends off the front foot
full and straight and Shehzad steps forward and blocks
disciplined as ever. Good probing full length and he's come closer and closer to off stump as the batsman covers the swing and defends
exploits his left-armer's angle across the right-hander and Hafeez is circumspect, watching it go through to the keeper on the front foot
full and just a tad outside off stump and he gets forward and dabs it in front of square on the off side to get off the mark
full length ball pushed across Shehzad who plays within himself as he lets this one go too
goes back, gets behind the line of that ball which was just back of a good length and defends solidly
shuffles back and across to cover his stumps and also allow him to work the length ball pitched on off stump off through midwicket to get his account started as well
back of a length ball angled across the batsman who is content with letting it through to the keeper
140.8 kph, full length ball just outside off stump and he is stuck in the crease as he pushes the ball into the covers
135 kph, right up there on middle stump and Shehzad stays solidly behind the line, nudges forward and blocks it
138kph, sprays it well down the leg side this time. That's not what we're used to from Steyn, but he did manage to keep it at a fuller length
much better, gets back on a length outside off stump, and he gets immediate encouragement as the batsman gets an outside edge which goes off to third man

that was just a push, but it was excellently placed between cover and extra. Hafeez wanted a third but he was sent back. It was a full length ball on off stump and he leaned into a checked drive. Will this be Hafeez's day?
full length ball, shaping just a hint away and he gets forward and defends safely
tucks him up as he targets the stumps and Hafeez stays on the back foot and blocks

hit on the up as that may just have bounced a little higher than he anticipated. Good line just outside off and he was looking to drive on the up, but only gets an outside edge which goes down to third man
back of a length outside off stump and the batsman lets it go to the keeper
well left. Tsotsobe bowls this one fuller and closer to off stump, but Hafeez seems to be aware of his off stump and shoulders arms
wider, but still on a full length but Hafeez is still not tempted to hang his bat
tries to get a little closer to off again, but still doesn't threaten the stumps so he doesn't bother with it
another good looking shot from Hafeez as he meets the full length ball outside off with a square drive
he is still getting a little shape away, but it isn't too dangerous as Shehzad gets back behind it and defends solidly
angles this one into the batsman but Shehzad blocks it away calmly
back of a length, just outside off and he punches it square through the off side
another indipper and this one was a little shorter, which leaves Shehzad wondering if he should get forward or back. In the end he manages an inside edge and run through for a single
short of a good length outside off stump and the batsman lets this one go through to the keeper as well. Very circumspect start here by Pakistan
comes forward and blocks as the ball takes the outside half of the bat and goes to point
another forward defensive and another dot ball, this was full and on the off stump corridor. South Africa at the same stage were 29 for 1
good shot for no runs still. It was on a good length angled across him and Shehzad punches it smartly off the back foot but it goes straight to point
a little more bounce there as Shehzad adjusts by taking the bottom hand off his bat. It was bowled back of a length on just outside off. South Africa have been brilliant at keeping up the pressure

excellent shot! Perfect straight drive and he poses for the photographeres as he watches the ball rush past mid-off. There was very little wrong with the ball as he bowled it full and on off stump, but this was just a very good shot. Pakistan need more of those
full length ball is worked away off middle stump to get off strike after the boundary

very wayward and the Umpire calls him on it. Shortish ball bowled far too wide outside off stump. The batsman did not move his feet while trying to cut and even if he had he still would not have reached it
gets much tighter on middle stump and Hafeez moves across to the off stump to tuck it away to midwicket and take a quick single
141 kph, short cover in play as Hafeez gets forward and pushes the full length ball into the off side
he wanted the single there but the ball went straight to short fine leg. It was full, almost a half-volley, and he whips it away off his pads but cannot beat Tsotsobe
just back of a length and outside off stump and as has been Pakistan's wont throughout this innings, Hafeez lets it go
very good shot. Covered the off stump to counter Steyn's away swing, but this didn;t have any and he works it off in the air and square of the man at fine leg and it races away
goes full and just outside off to compensate and Hafeez can only block it to mid-off
full and outside of off stump, but with a boundary already taken in the over, he shoulders arms
great stop. Faf du Plessis at backward point dives full length to his right as Shehzad cuts the shortish ball outside off stump

delicious strike. That's more like it from Pakistan. Room offered outside off stump and it was short enough for him to go back and just caress that ball through point for a boundary. And it screamed away as well
cut uppishly but he had placed it well away from the man at point as the short and wide ball goes down to third man
full length ball on middle and leg as he shuffles across to the off side and tucks it away through square leg
130 kph, firm drive to cover, but he can't beat the man. Tsotsobe had kept this on a fullish length and was pushing it across the right-hander as well
131 kph, pulled away on one leg as Tsotsobe strays too straight and with the shortish length it was just a matter of keeping it down, but South Africa have a man in the deep at square leg
and starts off with a fuller length than usual, but his customary bounce allows the batsman to defend off the back foot
just back of a length outside off stump and he gets back behind it and blocks
goes full and straight and with a little hint of inward movement the batsman gets forward and drives it down to long-on

oh, lovely ball that. Pitches it just short of a good length and gets the ball to straighten. Hafeez was sucked into defending the ball considering it was angled into him, but the movement takes it past the outside edge
gets forward and meets the full length ball on off stump with a defense, but the ball takes an outside edge to point
full and straight again as he comes forward and pushes the ball to mid-on

uses his feet and pulls out the big golf swing and we have another boundary. The ball went off the inside half of the bat but it was placed perfectly - right behind the bowler, and it just skipped away to the boundary
full and on middle and off as Shehzad gets behind it and blocks

shuffles across his stumps and pulls out a checked straight drive, but it was just a little too straight. The ball hits the stumps and had Tsotsobe managed to get a finger to that ball, Hafeez would have been out
back of a length outside off and he punches it into the covers
change of pace, but the batsman waits for it and gets forward to defend

125kph, comedy of errors there. The back of a length ball is pushed into the off side and Shehzad sets off for a single, but he is sent back. Tsotsobe rushed to get to ball but can't bend down to collect it. AB got to the ball but he hadn't got hold of the ball properly, by which time Shehzad had made it back and an easy run out opportunity goes begging
clipped away off the pads as he goes on the front foot to meet the fullish length ball, but there is a man in the deep
great shot! Short ball from Morkel and he sees it so early that the pull shot goes through wide mid-on.

punches straight down the ground off the back foot and there is another mix up between the two batsmen. Luckily they decide against the single soon enough return to the crease before the throw comes in from mid-on
short of a length which forces him onto his back foot and he works it away through square leg
short and at the body again, but this time Hafeez's pull shot doesnt connect  quite as well. But they take a single nonetheless
136 kph, on a good length just outside off stump as he gets behind it and blocks
140.7 kph, short ball angled at the body of the batsman who swivel pulls. But it was a little to quick for him as it goes off the splice to deep square leg
121 kph, slower ball but the batsman waits for it, opens the face of the bat as he pushes his weight on the back foot and guides it fine of point to pick up a single

back of a length ball outside off stump as he pushes it to point. It was played off soft hands and Hafeez was already running for the single, but Shehzad was very sluggish. Hafeez asks what's wrong as finally Shehzad makes a move
shortish ball angled across the batsman as he gets back behind it and blocks
flays through cover as he pushes it across the batsman's off stump. He wanted to tear the hide off that ball, his top hand coming off the bat
good short ball but its an even better shot as Hafeez pulls it away strongly over midwicket, but there is protection in the deep

edged and four. Fullish length on that off stump corridor, Hafeez was a little lackadaisical as he propped his bat out and a thick outside edge goes past the first slip and off to the third man boundary
full length ball on off stump and he gets forward to defend well
fullish length ball on and around off stump and it bounced just a little higher than he thought as Hafeez blocks it into the off side
he plugs away at a fullish length outside off and Hafeez presents a straight bat off the front  foot
back of a length outside off stump and Hafeez does not bother with it
he's learned his lesson after getting that outside edge it seems. Refuses to be tempted into playing at the fuller length ball outside off stump
loosener to start off with. It was full and swinging away, but it started far too much outside off
full length ball inviting the drive and the batsman obliged as he struck it to the left of short cover, where AB dived to make the save
uses the pace of the bowler as he guides the back of a length ball off the back foot to third man
picked up off the middle stump as he whips it away over square leg to record the second consecutive fifty partnership between these two
119 kph, slower ball. It was the off cutter and Shehzad dabs it at his feet off the back foot

129.9 kph, squares him up as Shehzad hangs his bat outside off stump. It was well outside off stump and didn't need to be played at, but he was looking to work it away to third man and was beaten comprehensively. Good bowling this
goes tight on middle stump and the length ball is picked away through square leg
lovely looking shot. Another back of a length delivery and he gets right on top of it as he punches it to point
good length on middle stump and the batsman works it away off his pads through square leg
full length just outside off stump as he lets it go through to the keeper and AB yells "lets get the rate up to seven now, boys"
and Faf rises to his captain's call, diving to his right to take control of a back foot punch by Hafeez to a shortish ball just outside off stump
goes fuller this time and he plays a checked drive straight to mid-on
fuller length on off stump and he comes forward and blocks to cover
opens the face to drive the full length ball outside off to point, but Faf does not let it pass him
much shorter this time and he stays on his back foot, rises to his full height and guides the ball off the face of his bat to deep third man
131 kph, thick outside edge, goes in the air through the vacant slips area and off to the third man boundary, McLaren shakes his head as his full length ball outside off did not deserve that
keeps it around the off stump corridor and he pushes it square on the off side to get off strike

moves around in his crease, making a lot of room for himself, but it was a double bluff. He gets back in line with the stumps as McLaren bowls an off cutter well outside off stump and Shehzad cannot reach it with his late cut
Good shot! It was short and just enough room for Shehzad to slap it over the top of point with a powerful cut shot
78 kph, tossed up outside off and he reaches out to block
78 kph, flatter ball allows the batsman to get back in his crease and pull away to deep square leg
79 kph, bowls it outside off at a fuller length and the batsman carefully lets it go

oh my god, that was a horrid ball! Waist high full toss and the batsman tucks into it, lofting him over the top of mid-on and it clears the boundary ropes as well to record the first six of the innings
tossed up outside off stump and he drives it square through the off side
back of a length on off stump and he punches it down the ground to retain strike and that will be drinks
back of a length at 130 kph. He goes back in his crease and pushes it down towards mid-on
117 kph, off cutter from McLaren, he's quite generous with those and the batsman comes forward to the full length ball and defends to cover
too much room and he is saved by Faf again. It was cut quite well off the back foot but went straight to the man at point
it just will not get past him. Another short ball outside off is met with a crisp cut shot but it cannot beat Faf
fuller length on middle and he blocks it towards mid-on off the back foot
good ball to end the over. Full and straight and the batsman can only block it down the pitch
tossed up on off stump and it is met with a forward defensive
that one gets a little bounce off  the pitch as he goes forward and tries to block it. Shehzad wanted a single but Hafeez sends him back
shortish ball just outside off stump and he cuts it well, behind point, where Morkel dives all over himself but still manages to hang on to the ball
goes on the back foot and punches it through the covers for a single

we have an appeal for a run-out and its AB de Villiers who rushed in from the covers, underarms the throw in to the keeper and finds Ahmed Shehzad short. That is a big blow for Pakistan. Hafeez had nudged it into the covers and immediately set off. Shehzad responded quickly enough but AB was just too good and Duminy continues his knack of picking up a wicket in his first over on this tour
its a good, full length ball to which he come forward and blocks quite well
played and missed. Sorry shot from Hafeez as the ball is rather innocuous, on a good length outside off stump. He goes for it but cannot connect

off cutter, seams into him quite a bit after pitching, and because of that it takes the inside edge as the batsman looked to drive through the off side, beats the diving Quinton de Kock behind the stumps

oh, he would have been out for one on his debut, but Faf cannot hit the stumps. Hafeez sold him a dummy there as he blocked the ball into the off side. He had a good line of sight at all three stumps but still could not throw them down
gets forward and drives the ball through the cover field on the off sdie for a single
lovely shot. Met it on the up with a lazily elegant square drive as he picks out the man at sweeper cover
bowls it right up there as he gets forward and pushes down the ground
oh, that was very close, but in the end it was a boundary. Smacks it straight over the top and AB backpeddles then leaps up and the ball just evades his outstretched fingers and runs away

gone, sneaks through bat and pad! That was a horrible shot, he was looking for the leg spinner there but the ball went straight on and shatters his off stump as a fan puts up a sign that reads "Imran Tahir come back 2 Pakistan"

and his stay at the crease is very brief. Tsotsobe has been getting a bit of extra bounce in his first spell as well and this time the leading edge lobs up in the air and the short midwicket fielder runs around to take a good, diving catch

loud appeal for caught behind, the bowler and keeper are convinced, but the umpire thinks it has touched nothing. And he is right, the full length ball which was intend to be flicked through to fine leg did not meet bat. It was the bat that touched the pad that made the sound
back of a length outside off stump and he guides it through to third man
brilliant short ball from Tsotsobe, right at the batsman's neck as he manages to fends it away to point by leaping off his feet
another good short ball, the bounce was a little lower this time, which allowed the batsman to work it away to fine leg
back of a length outside off and he guides it away wide of point to get off strike
tries the bouncer again, but Misbah effortlessly goes back and pulls the ball through square leg to retain strike
tossed up on leg stump as he presses forward and defends into the on side
flighted outside the off stump this time as Misbah pushes to cover
shorter, which allows Misbah to go back and cut the ball past point to take a single
flighted on middle and Maqsood drives the ball to long-on
drives the full length ball outside off back to the bowler
that kept a little low and Misbah on the back foot manages to jab it away to deep midwicket
fullish length ball on middle stump and he flicks it away to midwicket
on a good length but he still goes back and opens the face of the bat to find point
another fullish length ball, but Misbah is happy to stay on the back foot and guide it off the open face to point
shortish ball again and Misbah shuffles across his crease and works it away through square leg
powerful strike! It was just short enough for him to go back and he slammed it through midwicket for an impressive boundary. He's looking quite good out there
another back of a length ball as he moves across to the off side and works is off his hips for a single
cross-seamed delivery to start off as he keeps it full at 140 kph. Maqsood is stuck in the crease as he looks to block it, and he is just a tad slow on it
full and straight from Steyn and this time he gets back behind it and pushes it down to mid-on
shortish length ball and he goes back to work it away through square leg. Misbah wants too but Maqsood wasn't up for it. But that is the 100 for Pakistan

145.9kph, he's working up some mean pace here, possibly looking to work over the debutant and Pakistan's best bet to win this match. Short ball right at the body of Misbah as he fends it away into the off side
back of a length on off stump and he blocks it away through mid-on

142.3 kph bouncer right at the head of Misbah and he did well to get that away. It got to him very quick but Misbah adjusted his hook shot as best he could and hits the ball off to deep fine leg for a single
nicely placed by Misbah. There was a floating slip in position and he guides it to the left of the man and off to third man

what a shot! That was flicked over extra cover, how did he even do that?! It was back of a lenght outside off and I think he was just looking to push the ball into the off side, but he flicked his wrists at the time of impact and the ball just flew over the off side in field
another smashing drive from Maqsood. There was ample room outside off stump and he flays it through the off side for sweeper cover to clean up. He seems a terrific striker of the ball
bouncer from Tsotsobe, almost high enough to be a wide, but the batsman ducks beneath it safely

oh, what a ball! Quick bouncer right at the head of the batsman, who is committed to fending it away. The ball takes the glove and leaps up over the top of the diving wicketkeeper and goes away for a single
goes right across his stumps and flicks the full length ball on off stump through midwicket
on a length outside off stump and he goes across to meet it with a defensive bat
leading edge as he looks to flick the full length ball outside off through the leg side. Third man does the clean up
lots of pace from Steyn and they are certainly peppering Maqsood with the short ball. This one was around chest high and he tries to awkwardly block, whilst he was squared up
and he follows it up with a fuller ball, and Maqsood goes for the drive, gets a thick outside edge and he gets off strike as the ball goes to third man
just short of a length and angled into the batsman who works it off his hips into the midwicket region to get a single
139 kph, full and on off stump as he comes forward and drives to cover
full and on middle, but Misbah having moved across to the off side clips it away in the air through square leg and runs through for a couple
135 kph, full length ball on off stump and it is struck down the ground to mid-on
fullish length again, but the batsman was stuck in his crease as he blocked it to cover
143 kph, short ball around the off stump but he handled it well, guiding it away wide of point off the back foot to collect a single
145 kph, short again and this time Maqsood works it away off his stomach to deep fine leg
another shortish ball, this one outside off stump as Misbah taps it straight to point
back of a length ball on off stump and he pushes it through the covers
tossed up on middle and off and he pushes it back to the bowler
another shortish ball and Maqsood goes back to punch it through the point region. Faf runs around to try and cut it off, but can't stop the single
full toss and dealt with powerfully. Misbah meets this one after shuffling across to the off side and just whips it wide of the long-on fielder, whose dive is in vain
lunges forward and defends into the off side
nicely flighted again and Misbah is happy to prod it away into th off side

oh my God, that is another stunning strike. Morkel continues the short pitched ploy at him but he was waiting for it this time as evidenced by how he pulled the ball well in front of square. He's been mighty impressive in this innings
that was shortish again, just outside off and he guides it away to point where Faf dives to stop the single
full length ball on middle stump as Maqsood covers the line and keeps it out
slapped off the back foot to point again, as the ball was pitched just back of a length outside off stump
full length ball on off stump fetches a solid straight drive from Maqsood, but it goes straight to mid-off
full length ball on middle stump and Maqsood gets back behind it and keeps it out
attempts the reverse sweep, but just fails to put bat to ball and the keeper's pads makes sure the ball doesn't  go off for byes
flighted on off stump again as he gets forward and drives through the covers
mildly beats him in the flight as he looks to play across the line and cannot put bat to it and gets struck on the pads
full and on the pads and Maqsood whips it away through midwicket
googly from Tahir and Misbah was looking to flick it away fine, but the turn was too much as it takes the pad and trickles away

oh, another monstrous strike. He saw that was flighted, chips down the track and slaps it over the long-on boundary. Definitely looks like Inzy, on whom the commentators say he has modeled his play on

cheeky. It was a fullish length ball outside off stump and he opens the face of the bat at the very last instant to guide the ball fine of third man for a four. McLaren is not happy with the keeper for not stopping that though
angles in from outside the off stump and he uses it to work it away to midwicket
bouncer from McLaren and he ducks underneath it, although he needn't have to considering the ball was well above head high
another short pitched ball, outside off stump this time but the batsman goes back to pull the ball through straight midwicket
fuller and outside off stump and Misbah is hapy to let this go
short of a length again and Misbah who was going across to his off stump, dabs it away in the region of fine leg and takes the single
slower ball, 125 kph, it was shortish and the batsman goes for a wild pull shot, but misses completely
good length ball well outside off stump, but Misbah as he has been doing all innings moves across to the off stump and whips it away to wide long-on
full and wide outside off and Maqsood comes forward and drives the ball square to sweeper cover
gets it on the full and sweeps it well, but he cannot place the ball well enough to beat the man at short leg. He struck the ball mighty well though
this time he does it better. Full and it was just wide enough outside leg stump for him to get down on one knee and paddle it to the left of the short fine leg fielder
good length ball on middle and leg and Misbah pushes it down the ground to long-on
goes on the back foot to punch the flatter delivery just outside off thorough the covers. And that will be drinks
121 kph, off cutter and it grips in the wicket to dart into Misbah, who gets an inside edge as he looks to defend and the ball trickles away towards square leg
raises his hand immediately in apology after that full toss, just under waist high, which Maqsood hits right back to the bowler. Probably going for the yorker there
full length ball on middle and off and it is blocked down the pitch
another short ball, but these haven't been troubling Maqsood lately as he goes back and pulls the ball to deep midwicket
131 kph, on a good length outside off and Misbah uses it to guide the ball off to third man to pick up an easy single
drives on the up to the fullish length ball outside off. He beats the short cover fielder coming around in hopes of cutting the ball, but cannot evade mid-off
the reverse sweep connects, but timing and placement are lacking as the ball goes straight to short third man
quicker and flatter from Tahir, it was the slider, and Misbah was lucky not to be defeated by it as he manages an inside edge and the ball runs away behind square on the leg side
shortish ball outside off and is guided away to deep point off the back foot
no half measures this time, as he goes back and slams it over the square leg boundary. Poor ball met with a terrific strike
and he places faith in the googly again, this one was bowled much quicker at 90 kph and Maqsood did well to keep it out
shortish outside off stump and he goes back to cut the ball to the sweeper
138 kph, shortish ball allows the batsman to go back and pulls the ball through to deep midwicket
138 kph, quick single. he played that with such soft hands, dabbing it in the region of point off the back foot and charges off down the pitch

loud appeal for caught behind from Morkel and de Kock joins in but the umpire Gould is unmoved. He was beaten as he looked to drive the ball on the up off the back foot, there was lots of daylight between bat and pad though

and thatfifty on debut for Maqsood and it comes off a solid shot through fine leg. Sevent Pakistan batsman to get to that landmark in his first ODI. It was full and going down leg side and he got just enough bat on it to collect another boundary.
oh, stand and deliver. It was a length ball, he just opened up his stance and slapped it over the extra cover region for a thumping boundary
and what a response from Morkel, bowls the perfect yorker on middle and off and Maqsood does well to dig it out
136 kph, fullish length on middle stump and Misbah who had shuffled across his stumps and works it away through square leg
a little inward movement, but Maqsood stays back in his crease and punches it down the ground to mid-off
146 kph, and that got a little extra bounce as well, possibly because of holding the ball cross-seamed. Maqsood has a waft at it outside off stump and is beaten. Great ball from Steyn

lovely catch from the captain and Steyn strikes! It was a full length ball homing in on off stump and Maqsood goes for it once again, but this time he cannot get it off the middle. AB runs back from mid-off and leaps up behind him to hold on to a good catch and punches the air in delight
145 kph, full and wide outside off stump and Misbah leans into a drive through the off side
120 kph, slower ball from Steyn and Misbah gets back behind the ball and defends
142 kph, swing and a miss first up from Tanvir as Morkel bowls a fullish length ball angled across the left-hander
another little waft outside off stump. This seamed away just a tad and Tanvir went chasing after it, with lead feet
full length ball, driven off the front foot to mid-off, Steyn takes aim from mid-off but doesnt break down the stumps. Tanvir was not even in the frame
short of a length ball, with ample room outside off stump. Misbah had already committed to the front foot and he couldn't adjust his weight properly to connect with the ball off the cut shot
shortish outside off again and Misbah guides the ball off the back foot to point
fuller this time and Misbah gets forward and steers the ball down to third man
heaved away over point as Steyn bowls a fuller length outside off stump. He had planted his front foot outside leg and carved it over the point fielder
slower ball which is full and on middle stump and he works the ball off into the deep midwicket region
146 kph bouncer, but he got his radar wrong. it was well down the leg side for the left-hander, who ducked underneath it
goes for another wild slog and fails to connect. It was a fullish length ball, cross-seamed again, just outside off stump and Tanvir was looking to plant that over the long-on boundary

what a bouncer! Perfectly directed, around head high and the pinch hitter ploy fails. Tanvir was more trying to protect himself as he swiped at that ball, which went high in the air and down to deep fine leg where Hashim Amla settles himself underneath it, dives to his left as the ball swirls and takes a good catch
full length outside off stump and Misbah chops it into the ground and the ball goes off to the keeper
shuffles right across to the off side to meet this full length ball and whips it off to midwicket to retain strike

he has creamed that! It was another short ball, there was a little bit on inward movement, and Misbah went back and pulled it with the utmost power through to the square leg boundary. First boundary in 20 balls
full length ball outside off stump and he drives it handsomely to the man at extra cover
fifty reached with a six. Gets down on one knee to get under than length ball and slogged it over cow corner.
yorker outside off stump, but with Misbah moving across his stumps, digs the ball out and collects a single
good length ball outside off steered to third man to get off the mark
full and angled down the leg side. And he is rightly wided
fullish and wide outside off stump as he dabs the ball to point off the back foot to collect a single
tossed up on middle as Misbah comes forward and defends solidly
drops it a little short and Misbah is quick to go back and pull it straight of midwicket for a single
full and flighted outside off stump and Akmal gets forward to drive through extra cover. He beats the fielder and calls for two
that was the googly, and it gets a little extra bounce as he  comes forward to defend and is struck on the pads
comes down the track, makes room for himself while doing so and goes for a wild slog over the off side. The ball turns and takes the outside edge and goes on the bounce to short third man
short and wide outside off stump and he cuts it strongly to the sweeper to collect another couple and take his side to 200.
full length ball angling into the batsman who works it away though midwicket to rotate strike
another off cutter from McLaren ad Misbah waits for the inward cut and guides it away to point
shiffle across to the off stump to meet the full length ball outside off stump and pushes it through the covers
shortish ball outside off and Akmal plays it late to third man off the back foot
132 kph, short ball just outside off stump and Misbah chops it off to third man to collect another single
slammed through extra cover! It was overpitched on off stump and did Akmal ever climb into it. Got on the front foot and hit through the line of the ball. There was no stopping that
91 kph, pushed through on off stump and Misbah covers the line and defends
tossed up a little more and Misbah reaches out for it outside off stump and pushes it to cover
this was on middle and leg as Misbach works it away toward square leg and Akmal calls him through for the single
fuller length ball again he taps it down to long-on for an easy single
and there's the inevitable bad ball for the over from Tahir, short and wide outside off and Misbah goes back and pulls it strongly to deep midwicket
flighted outside off and Akmal went down to slow sweep it, but he was going a little too hard. So the ball squirts off the inside edge towards midwicket
starts off with a back of a length ball outside off stump and gets slapped over the top of cover by Akmal
moves across his stumps to work the full length ball on middle and off down to deep fine leg

full and wide outside off stump and he carves it over points head. That was a terrific strike. All bottom hand in that shot. Usually that would be hit over mid-off but not Akmal. He chose the more difficult route and pulled it off!
shortish on off stump and he was going for it again. His weight was on the back foot and pulls it down to long-on
and as against Akmal's muscly strokes, here is Misbah using the pace of the bowler as he taps the good length ball down to third man
charges the bowler and meets it on the full, but the bat turns in his hand on impact as he drills it down to long-on for a single
starts off with a cutter and he beats Umar Akmal's dab off the back foot to third man. He isn't too happy with his efforts having missed that one
full but just a tad outside leg stump and the batsman easily works it away to the man at deep fine leg
full length ball on middle and leg and Misbah having moved across to the off side, whips it away to deep midwicket
attempts a hoick across the line to the full length delivery on and around off stump and misses
charges the bowler, but he started too early allowing Tstosobe to pull his length back. He checks his shot, pushing it into the off side and collecting a single
full and on the pads, Misbah clips it away to deep fine leg off the back foot and becomes the leading run-scorer in ODIs for 2013.
shortish delivery outside off stump and he guides the ball down to third man to collect an easy single
extra bounce from Morkel as Akmal's efforts to ride the bounce and upper cut the ball is thwarted
goes fuller this time and homes in on leg stump and with Akmal making a little room for himself, he drills the ball into the covers

shortish ball angled into the pads of the batsman, but he was moving across to the off side to paddle the ball away and because of that he misses out and it is a legal delivery because had the batsman remained in his stance that would not have gone down the leg side
short and wide and asking to be hit, but the cut shot from Akmal finds point

oh, he had given up and had AB hit, it would have been all over. It was a full ball, drilled down to mid-off and Akmal took off, but he had hit the ball too well. AB sets himself up and attacks the stumps, but misses

and Steyn provides the wicket again! It was full and on of the off stump. Akmal went for the huge heave over midwicket, but got a leading edge and the ball sailed to the third man boundary where the Morne Morkel was lurking. He used his full height, settles himself on the boundary and timed his jump backwards perfectly to take a great catch
full and wide outside off stump and he steers it away to third man for another single
length ball outside off stump and he cuts it away to point

double-strike for Steyn! And its the big wicket, Misbah is gone! Full length ball and he wanted to whack it over deep midwicket. But he had not hit it quite as well as he would have liked as the ball got too much height and AB comes in from the boundary and takes a cool catch
length ball on middle and off and Afridi gets forward and slogs it in the air down to long-on

143 kph, what was he doing there? Ajmal was looking to pull a good length ball that rushed through and shattered his stumps. Steyn has three in his over and has five for the match. This is his best bowling figures in ODIs. He is pumped!
wide almost-yorker, and Afridi was looking flay it through the covers but doesn't even connect
in swing for McLaren and he uses it to bolster the yorker. Afridi mimics the shape the ball followed with his hand after missing the ball while looking to drill it down the ground
full length ball on middle and off and Afridi manages to power the ball to deep extra cover

and finally South Africa get a direct hit and Afridi is not even in the frame. Faf du Plessis had one-and-a-half stumps to aim at from backward point and he nails it. It was a short ball from McLaren and Irfan managed to fend it away. Afridi called him through for the single, and has obviously underestimated Faf's skills in he field
full and straight he does well to dig it out. The ball runs away towards midwicket and the batsmen sneak a couple
another yorker from McLaren. This is exactly why South Africa hold him back and his accuracy matches up as Junaid keeps this one out as he pushes down the ground
length ball on middle, which forces the batsman back into his crease and awkwardly push down the ground
full length ball again, homing on on middle and Irfan stays safely leg side of the ball and pushes it down the ground for a single
110 kph, off cutter from Steyn and the change of pace beats Juniaid's intended flick shot and hits his thigh pad
short ball outside off stump but Junaid is not interested
another short ball, this time better directed as Junaid moves towards the leg side and looks to cut. The ball bounces higher than he thought it would and beats him
this time he bowls a full length ball to which Junaid attempts a slog through the off side but misses
right up there on middle stump and Irfan keeps it out as he drives down the ground and manages to get a single

and there it is! leg stump yorker breaches his defences and South Africa have the win and the series. Junaid wanted to drill it through the off side again, but it was just too quick for him. McLaren punches the air, AB de Villiers kisses the South Africa crest on his uniform and that is that
